sections.heading: Legislative purpose - Reassignment of allocations
sections.text:
(a)The purpose of this chapter is to provide a procedure for allocating the state's private activity bond authority among governmental units in the state having the authority to issue bonds under the Tax Reform Act of 1986.(b)Allocations to local governments may be reassigned for issuance to all boards and authorities authorized to issue bonds on behalf of governmental units.Acts 1985, ch. 237, § 2; 1987, ch. 57, §§ 2-5.

sections.heading: Authority for allocating state's bond authority
sections.text:
There is hereby created in the department of economic and community development the authority for the commissioner, under this chapter, to allocate the state's bond authority among governmental units having authority to issue bonds.Acts 1985, ch. 237, § 3.

sections.heading: Preparation, distribution and contents of allocation plans
sections.text:
The commissioner shall, prior to January 1 of each year, prepare and distribute an allocation plan for bonds that meets the following goals:(1)Provides equal access to the state bond authority for large cities, small towns and rural areas; and(2)Provides the most benefit to the state from the bond authority available to it.Acts 1985, ch. 237, § 4.

sections.heading: Reports
sections.text:
(a)Prior to January 31 of each year, the commissioner shall report to the general assembly on the administration of the bond allocation program. This report shall contain, but not be limited to, the following information about bond issues approved and disapproved:(1)Amount;(2)Purpose; and(3)Location.(b)The commissioner may include in this report any additional information that will assist the general assembly in evaluating the administration of the bond allocation program.Acts 1985, ch. 237, § 5.
